p.strong: SY.PRODUCT.VARIANT is used to define the description, categories and advices that are specific to a particular variant of a Structured Product. For example, an Accumulator product can have several variants like Accumulators with Gearing, Accumulators with Minimum accrual period etc. If a bank wants to send separate advices for each type of Accumulator or wants to differentiate the Profit or Loss from each variant, they can use this SY.PRODUCT.VARIANT table.

ovdesc.p: This file is not mandatory. If set and linked to the SY product record, system will take the values from this file while processing the product and raising the entries. The ID should be in the format "SY.PRODUCT.DEFINITION_VARIANT". The values from SY.PRODUCT.DEFINITION get defaulted here. The values can be changed as required and then they become specific to this variant of the product. When an SY contract is input, values will be defaulted from the SY.PRODUCT.VARIANT specified.The fields here are replica of fields in the SY.PRODUCT.DEFINTION and it is suggested that Help text of the field in SY.PRODUCT.DEFINITION be referred for additional details.

If valuation of this variant requires some specific method or formula, then a valuation routine can be attached here. This will override the gerneric valuation routine, if any, that is attached to the parent SY.PRODUCT.DEFINITION. The Valuation routine must have an associated PGM.FILE record. The routine should have two arguments. First incoming arugument to hold SC.POS.ASSET key and the second argument, which is the outgoing argument should be the SC.POS.ASSET record built by the valuation routine.

This should be the one of the events in the SY.PRODUCT.DEFINITION of the variant defined.

Different SY.PRODUCTS and variants normally follow common SY.EVENTs like Accrual, Fixing etc. The common SY.EVENT.DEFINITION record can be set to either run ONLINE or during COB. However, for certain specific SY Product variants, a particular activity may need to run Online rather than during COB and vice-versa. This value in this field takes presendence over value in COB phase of SY.EVENT.DEFINITION. For example,in the SY.EVENT.DEFINITION, fixing event can be set to run during COB on the fixing date. However, for a particular variant of Accumulators which is based on US Stocks, the price may be available only the day after the fixing date. Hence the Fixing event should not run during the COB on the fixing date but rather the users would prefer to run this Online after receiving the correct price. In such situations, a variant can be created for Accumulators on US stocks and this field can be set to ONLINE.

desc.p: Accrual of shares can be suspended for an accumulator/decumulator contract due to an corporate action or due to undeclared stock exchange holiday. This field controls the accrual for suspended days.
This field will be defaulted from SY.PRODUCT.DEFINITION.
This field is not applicable for the following products DCD, DSP, OTCCRAN, OTCGROI.
Allowed values -
'YES' - when the suspension is reset, accrual would be carried out for the suspended days using the latest availlable price.
'NO' - accrual would resume from the reset date, units for the suspended days are not recovered.
This field determines the accrual basis for equity accumulator/decumulator contracts. This field will be defaulted from SY.PRODUCT.DEFINITION.
This field is not applicable for the following products DCD, DSP, OTCCRAN, OTCGROI.
Allowed values -
'First' - Accrual on value date , no accrual on the final fixing or maturity date. Accrual for interim fixing date added to next fixing.
'Last' - No accrual on value date, accrual on the final fixing date. Accrual for the interim fixing date added to the current fixing.
'Both' - Accrual on value date and the final fixing date. Accrual for the interim fixing date added to the current fixing.
